text: if you're like me and you love spicy
foods you'll know that chili sauce or
chili oil is a must-have when pairing
with Asian dishes so today I'm going to
show you guys how to make a super quick
and easy homemade chili sauce using
fresh chilies now this is part of a
video collaboration with Beck from
entertaining with Beth where last week I
had the amazing opportunity to visit her
kitchen in person and show her how to
make shrimp and pork pot stickers
it was really fun and I had such a great
time so do check out the video on our
youtube channel where you can find us
making delicious pot stickers preparing
with this homemade chili sauce so now
that I have all the ingredients ready to
go let's get started first let's start
with our Chili's I am using red Fresno
chilies but feel free to use your
favorite chili variety then go ahead and
roughly cut about 5 chilies putting them
into a food processor chop and grind
them until the texture is to your liking
and since I tend to like a little more
texture with my chili sauce I am going
to go with a coarse grind after that
transfer the chilies to a pan and saute
them on a low heat for a minute or two
allowing any excess moisture to
evaporate then add three to four
tablespoons of canola oil 1/4 teaspoon
of sugar 1/4 teaspoon of salt and one
teaspoon of white wine vinegar adjust
the heat if you need to so the oil is
just hot enough to cook the chiles if
it's smoking it's too hot saute the
mixture for 6 to 8 minutes allowing the
aroma of the chiles to really blend and
infuse into the oil then when it's done
reduce the heat to low and add one clove
of freshly minced garlic now garlic does
burn easily so make sure you're using a
low heat continue sauteing the garlic
for another minute and then you're done
at that point I usually transfer
mine too a small dish to let cool before
serving
so that's how easy it is to make
homemade chili sauce now I can't tell
you how much better this taste compared
to store-bought sauces because there's
no artificial ingredients no
preservatives it's just real fresh
ingredients customized to your taste now
in addition to spicing up your stir
fries one of my favorite ways to use
chili sauce is for pot stickers I like
to take a scoop or two of chili sauce a
splash of sesame oil maybe a little bit
of soy sauce mix that all together and
the flavors are just amazing and if
you're interested in learning how to
make pot stickers don't forget to head
on over to best channel where we'll be
making them together now since I have a
batch of pot stickers here and some
chili sauce that we just made I am just
going to dig in a little bit of chilli
sauce
mmm so good I don't know what I would do
without chili sauce I'm angel I hope you
guys enjoyed this video give me a thumbs
up if you liked this chili sauce recipe
and don't forget to subscribe to my
channel angel Wong's kitchen for more
authentic Asian recipes made simple and
fun I'll see you guys soon bye
